result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D. DeVeau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**69 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF1359.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan D. DeVeau

records.addlTxt: Ck# 44329 mailed to Huebsch; RE restitution

Restitution Ordered in the amount of $1,752.23
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Proposed Restitution Ordered

Cases called at 10:00 AM: 21CF428, 22CF215, 21CF594, 22CF329, 21CF1359, 21CM368, 21CF668, 22CF459, 22CM339, 22CM308, 22CF253, 21CF1355, 21CF870, 21CM91, 22CF216.
Defendant Ryan D. DeVeau in court, in custody with Attorney David W. Field  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State recommends 1 Year Jail with Huber in 21CF428, 22CF215, and 21CF594. As to 22CF329 and 21CF1359, the State recommends a Withheld Sentence and 5 Years of Probation (Consecutive to the 1 Year Jail).

Defense adopts the DOC recommendation:
21CF428: 2 Years Probation.
22CF329: 4 Years Probation (with 4-6 months conditional jail time) with 3 Years of Initial Confinement and 2 Years of Extended Supervision Imposed and Stayed.
21CF1359: Ct 1 and Ct 2: 2 Years Probation.
Ct. 3:  3 years Probation with 12 Months Initial Confinement and 12 months Extended Supervision Imposed and Stayed.
21CF594: 3 Years Probation with 12 Months Initial Confinement and 12 Months of Extended Supervision Imposed & Stayed.
22CF215:  2 Years Probation.

Defendant makes a statement to the Court.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

21CF428: 5 Months of Jail with Huber with 169 days of sentence credit (Concurrent).
22CF215: 5 Months of Jail with Huber with 66 days of sentence credit (Concurrent).
21CF594: 5 Months of Jail with Huber with 66 days of sentence credit. (Concurrent).
22CF329, 22CF1359: Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 4 Years of Probation (Concurrent to the 5 Months Jail) with the following conditions:
120 Days of Jail on each count (Concurrent, with Huber, and stayed pending further order of the Court ). AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
GPS Monitoring. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.  
No contact with Peterson Automotive, Karl's Appliances, T.S. or their residence, T.H., M.F.,  Adam's Automotive, R.N., Auto Value, Fleet Farm, Hope Gospel Used Cars, Huebsch Linen, P.H. or their business,
any salvage yard, metal dealers, or any business that buys or sells catalytic converters.
Defendant is granted 69 days of credit in 22CF329 and 68 days of credit in 21CF1359.

Restitution in the following amounts:
21CM91: $1,328.34 plus the 10% surcharge, for a total of $1,461.17
21CM368: $423.84 plus the 10% surcharge, for a total of $466.28
21CF1359: $2,623.59 plus the 10% surcharge, for a total of $2,885.95
22CF215: $500..00 plus the 10% surcharge, for a total of $550.00
State has 60 days to submit any additional restitution.
CONFIDENTIAL

(Cases called at 2:18 PM - 21CF428, 21CF594, 21CF668, 21CF870, 21CF1355, 21CF1359, 21CM91, 21CM368, 22CF215, 22CF216, 22CF253, 22CF329, 22CF459, 22CM308, 22CM339)  All parties for this hearing appear via Zoom videoconference.
Defendant Ryan DeVeau appears in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail via videoconference.  Attorney David Field appears via videoconference.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears via videoconference for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense argues that $21,000 cash already posted in bond is enough of an incentive for him to appear at sentencing, and that the additional $10,000 cash bond (not posted) should be amended.  Defense requests electronic monitoring.  State requests that bond be revoked in all cases.  Court grants the State's request to revoke bond in all matters and denies Defense motion to amend bond.
Bail/bond hearing on July 27, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)

(Cases called at 1:38 PM - 21CF428, 21CF594, 21CF668, 21CF870, 21CF1355, 21CF1359, 21CM91, 21CM368, 22CF215, 22CF216, 22CF253, 22CF329, 22CF459, 22CM308, 22CM339)
Defendant Ryan DeVeau appears in custody via videoconference from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney David Field appears in the Dunn County courtroom.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears for the State of Wisconsin via Zoom videoconference. 
Defendant waives personal appearance and approves appearing via Zoom.  State outlines the agreement for the Court.  Defendant acknowledges Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form.  Defendant is advised of the elements of the offenses to which he will plead, as well as the maximum possible penalties.  Defendant enters pleas of No Contest to 21CF428 Count 2: Possession of Methamphetamine; 21CF594 Count 2: Felony Bail Jumping; 21CF1359 Count 1: Possession of Burglarious Tools, Count 2: Removal of a Major Part of a Vehicle, Count 3: Felony Bail Jumping; 22CF215 Count : Removal of a Major Part of a Vehicle; and 22CF329 Count 1:Burglarly of a Building or Dwelling.  Defendant advised of his Constitutional rights.  Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty of the charges to which he has pled.  All remaining charges and the entirety of 21CF668, 21CF870, 21CF1355, 21CM91, 21CM368, 22CF216, 22CF253, 22CF459, 22CM308, 22CM339)Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation.  (off record for scheduling)  Defense advises that it plans to file a bond modification motion and requests a separate date for that.
Bond Modification Hearing: July 27, 2022 at 2:15 PM (via Zoom with Branch 6 in Eau Claire open)
Sentencing Hearing: September 29, 2022 at 10:00 AM (All in person; due date for PSI is 2 weeks prior to Sentencing Hearing date)

State needs times to review potential referral for new charge(s).  Off record for scheduling.

11:33 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ryan D. DeVeau appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Alicia Linzmeier. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. State asks for $15,000 cash bond with argument. Defense objects to high cash bond and asks for lower cash bond or a signature bond. Court orders a $10,000 cash bond. Time limits for the preliminary hearing are waived. Return to court: 3/25/22 at 9:00 AM in Branch 1 to ride along with other files.
